arts.ttl: Coventry City take 'blame' after 'maginificent' display at Watford
arts.sum: Ellis Simms gave the Sky Blues a fourth minute lead against Watford and the manager concedes that the game should have been out of sight by the break, after which the Hornets battled back to draw 1-1 before Haji Wright missed a glorious late chance to snatch the full three points when he headed onto the far post from close range. I think we took the hardest chance of the game and missed the others, and we can only blame ourselves for not getting the three points because it should have been over by half-time, way over by half-time.

arts.ttl: Watford 1 Coventry 1 - how the game unfolded
arts.sum: How the game unfolded at Vicarage Road as Watford came from behind to remain unbeaten at home under Tom Cleverley.

arts.ttl: Andy Turner's Coventry City player ratings as Sky Blues give up lead to settle for decent away point - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Coventry then went agonisingly close to restoring their lead when substitute Haji Wright threw himself at a far post cross from Mason-Clark and headed onto the woodwork. Oliver Dovin made two decent saves early in the second half as Tom Cleverley’s men launched a determined fight-back and eventually got their rewards when Tom Dele-Bashiru thumped home at the far post from a Giorgi Chakvetadze cross in the 67th minute.

arts.ttl: Watford and Coventry share the points after entertaining draw
arts.sum: It was an awful start for the home side, who for the third game in a row fell behind after less than four minutes of the contest.

arts.ttl: Four changes and formation switch as Mark Robins names his Coventry City team to face Watford
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Bobby Thomas, Joel Latibeaudiere, Liam Kitching; Milan van Ewijk; Josh Eccles, Victor Torp; Jay Dasilva; Jack Rudoni, Ephron Mason-Clark; Ellis Simms. To do that, we have launched a Sky Blues WhatsApp group to get the latest transfer news sent straight to your phone.

arts.ttl: Watford v Coventry City live match updates and teams from Vicarage Road
arts.sum: To do that, we have launched a Sky Blues WhatsApp group to get the latest transfer news sent straight to your phone. Either way, City will be keen to bounce back from their narrow 1-0 home defeat to Norwich last time out and kick start their season with their first win on the road.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola reveals why Manchester City refused to move their Carabao Cup clash against Watford to London, forcing them to play twice in just 49 HOURS later this month
arts.sum: The Premier League champions are gearing up for the first intense stretch of the new campaign as European commitments are added to domestic cup and league matches.

arts.ttl: Coventry City's stance on loan market amid concerns of Robins being left short
arts.sum: He added: “But if you have good loan players from top clubs then they can make a difference, as they have done in the past, and obviously we have converted some of them into permanents, namely Callum O’Hare being one of them. That season’s squad also included three of the club’s most successful players in years in Viktor Gyokeres, Callum O’Hare and Ben Sheaf, who also started out as loans before upgrading to permanent contracts.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins clarifies Coventry City criticism & building towards top six
arts.sum: That’s fair enough but what I was talking about was that when we made the changes and the new players come on, and there were three out of the five substitutes, sometimes they are not making the right movements to break down a block that Norwich put in place, but also gave them a leg up in terms of enabling them to keep possession for too long. Tatsu has only missed half a game against Norwich but when they are out, you miss them, and in terms of the training sessions, you want them involved, so it’s a step in the right direction.”
